hints.label: thm-lsi-qsd
hints.title: Log-Sobolev Inequality (LSI) for QSD
hints.content:
162: :label: thm-lsi-qsd
163: 
164: There exists a constant $\lambda_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ such that for all probability densities $\rho$ on $\Omega$:
165: 
166: $$
167: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) \le \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty)
168: $$
hints.raw_directive:
159: The core of hypocoercivity is relating Fisher information to KL divergence:
160: 
161: :::{prf:theorem} Log-Sobolev Inequality (LSI) for QSD
162: :label: thm-lsi-qsd
163: 
164: There exists a constant $\lambda_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ such that for all probability densities $\rho$ on $\Omega$:
165: 
166: $$
167: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) \le \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty)
168: $$
169:

hints.title: Explicit LSI Constant
hints.content:
222: :label: thm-lsi-constant-explicit
223: 
224: The LSI constant for the QSD satisfies:
225: 
226: $$
227: \boxed{\lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\alpha_{\exp}}{1 + C_{\Delta v}/\alpha_{\exp}}}
228: $$
229: 
230: where:
hints.raw_directive:
219: The true QSD $\rho_\infty^x(v)$ is not exactly Gaussian, but it's close (bounded perturbation). Using perturbative LSI theory (Holley-Stroock):
220: 
221: :::{prf:theorem} Explicit LSI Constant
222: :label: thm-lsi-constant-explicit
223: 
224: The LSI constant for the QSD satisfies:
225: 
226: $$
227: \boxed{\lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\alpha_{\exp}}{1 + C_{\Delta v}/\alpha_{\exp}}}
228: $$
229: 
230: where:
231: - $\alpha_{\exp}$ is the exponential concentration rate from (R6)

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-79
hints.content:
234: 
235: :::{prf:proof}
236: The proof follows from the Holley-Stroock perturbation theorem. The reference Gaussian measure $\mu(v) = (2\pi/\alpha_{\exp})^{-d/2} e^{-\alpha_{\exp}|v|^2/2}$ has LSI constant $\lambda_0 = \alpha_{\exp}$.
237: 
238: The log-ratio $\log(\rho_\infty^x / \mu)$ satisfies:
239: 
240: $$
241: \left|\Delta_v \log \frac{\rho_\infty^x}{\mu}\right| = |\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty^x - \Delta_v \log \mu| = |\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty^x + \alpha_{\exp} d|
242: $$
243: 
244: Using $\|\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty\|_{L^\infty} \le C_{\Delta v}$:
245: 
246: $$
247: \left|\Delta_v \log \frac{\rho_\infty^x}{\mu}\right| \le C_{\Delta v} + \alpha_{\exp} d
248: $$
249: 
250: The Holley-Stroock theorem gives:
251: 
252: $$
253: \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\lambda_0}{1 + C_{\text{perturb}}/\lambda_0}
254: $$
255: 
256: where $C_{\text{perturb}} = C_{\Delta v}$. Substituting $\lambda_0 = \alpha_{\exp}$:
257: 
258: $$
259: \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\alpha_{\exp}}{1 + C_{\Delta v}/\alpha_{\exp}}

hints.label: lem-fisher-bound
hints.title: Fisher Information Bound
hints.content:
306: :label: lem-fisher-bound
307: 
308: There exists a constant $c_F > 0$ such that:
309: 
310: $$
311: I_v(\rho) \ge c_F I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{rem}}
312: $$
313: 
314: where $c_F = 1/2$ and $C_{\text{rem}} = 4C_{\nabla v}^2$.
315: 
316: Consequently:
317: 
318: $$
319: \boxed{I_v(\rho) \ge 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{LSI}}}
320: $$
hints.raw_directive:
303: **Simplified bound** (sufficient for hypocoercivity):
304: 
305: :::{prf:lemma} Fisher Information Bound
306: :label: lem-fisher-bound
307: 
308: There exists a constant $c_F > 0$ such that:
309: 
310: $$
311: I_v(\rho) \ge c_F I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{rem}}
312: $$
313: 
314: where $c_F = 1/2$ and $C_{\text{rem}} = 4C_{\nabla v}^2$.
315: 
316: Consequently:
317: 
318: $$
319: \boxed{I_v(\rho) \ge 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{LSI}}}
320: $$
